recipe.title: Raw Broad Bean Dip with Mint
recipe.description: This vibrant-coloured dip is a delicious and interesting way to eat broad beans. It can be served either as a dip or spread, or it can be loosened by adding more olive oil and used as a raw, pesto-like sauce for pasta.
recipe.directions: Shell the beans and then peel off the white skin on each bean by digging your thumbnail or the tip of a sharp knife into each bean to break the skin and then peel it off. Place the beans and garlic in the bowl of a food processor or a mortar and pestle and process to a coarse puree. Scrape into a bowl and fold in the parmesan, lemon juice and zest, mint and olive oil. If you want a thick coarse dip or spread use less oil - if you want to use it as a sauce for pasta - use a little more. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve. >
